abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project would finance part
            of the original phase 1 of the Assab port development
            designed to provide a modest increase in port capacity. It
            would also carry out preparatory work for a major port
            expansion under phase 2.  The proposed project would:  (a)
            relieve congestion at the Assab port; (b) alleviate
            bottlenecks at Assab; (c) carry out the detailed engineering
            and other studies of phase 2; and (d) finance studies of the
            Marine Transport Authority's (MTA) staffing, training,
            cost accounting and tariffs.  The project, itself, would
            involve several components.  They include:  (i) tug berth
            construction; (ii) port cargo handling and workshop
            equipment; as well as (iii) site investigation and detailed
            engineering for phase 2 development of the Assab port.  The
            project would also finance; (iv) a study to update economic
            analysis of phase 2 together with financial analysis; (v) a
            study of MTA's manpower development, cost accounting
            and tariffs; and (vi) training of MTA staff.  The
            construction of the tug berth will release an existing berth
            for general cargo use.
